t: Matthew 23
Pharisaism Exposed
Then*p Jesus spoke to the crowds and to His disciples,
saying: “The*r scribes*r and*r the*r Pharisees*r have*r seated*r themselves*r in*r the*r chair*r of*r Moses;*r
therefore*r all*r that*r they*r tell*r you,*r do*r and*r observe,*r but*r do*r not*r do*r according*r to*r their*r deeds;*r for*r they*r say*r things*ir and*r do*r not*r do*r them.*ir
They*r tie*r up*r heavy*r burdens*r and*r lay*r them*r on*r men’s*r shoulders,*r but*r they*r themselves*r are*r unwilling*r to*r move*r them*r with*r so*ir much*ir as*ir a*r finger.*r
But*r they*r do*r all*r their*r deeds*r to*r be*r noticed*r by*r men;*r for*r they*r broaden*r their*r phylacteries*r and*r lengthen*r the*r tassels*r of*ir their*ir garments.*ir
They*r love*r the*r place*r of*r honor*r at*r banquets*r and*r the*r chief*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r
and*r respectful*r greetings*r in*r the*r market*r places,*r and*r being*r called*r Rabbi*r by*r men.*r
But*r do*r not*r be*r called*r Rabbi;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Teacher,*r and*r you*r are*r all*r brothers.*r
Do*r not*r call*r anyone*ir on*r earth*r your*r father;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Father,*r He*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
Do*r not*r be*r called*r leaders;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Leader,*r that*ir is,*ir Christ.*r
But*r the*r greatest*r among*r you*r shall*r be*r your*r servant.*r
Whoever*r exalts*r himself*r shall*r be*r humbled;*r and*r whoever*r humbles*r himself*r shall*r be*r exalted.*r
Eight Woes

“But*rp woe*r to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites,*r because*r you*r shut*r off*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r from*r people;*r for*r you*r do*r not*r enter*r in*r yourselves,*r nor*r do*r you*r allow*r those*r who*r are*r entering*r to*r go*r in.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites,*r because*r you*r travel*r around*r on*r sea*r and*r land*r to*r make*r one*r proselyte;*r and*r when*r he*r becomes*r one,*r you*r make*r him*r twice*r as*r much*r a*r son*r of*r hell*r as*r yourselves.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you,*r blind*r guides,*r who*r say,*r ‘Whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r temple,*r that*ir is*r nothing;*r but*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r gold*r of*r the*r temple*r is*r obligated.’*r
You*r fools*r and*r blind*r men!*r Which*r is*r more*r important,*r the*r gold*r or*r the*r temple*r that*r sanctified*r the*r gold?*r
And,*r ‘Whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r altar,*r that*ir is*r nothing,*r but*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r offering*r on*r it,*r he*r is*r obligated.’*r
You*r blind*r men,*r which*r is*r more*r important,*r the*r offering,*r or*r the*r altar*r that*r sanctifies*r the*r offering?*r
Therefore,*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r altar,*r swears*r both*ir by*r the*r altar*r and*r by*r everything*r on*r it.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r are*r like*r whitewashed*r tombs*r which*r on*r the*r outside*r appear*r beautiful,*r but*r inside*r they*r are*r full*r of*r dead*r men’s*r bones*r and*r all*r uncleanness.*r
So*r you,*r too,*r outwardly*r appear*r righteous*r to*r men,*r but*r inwardly*r you*r are*r full*r of*r hypocrisy*r and*r lawlessness.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r build*r the*r tombs*r of*r the*r prophets*r and*r adorn*r the*r monuments*r of*r the*r righteous,*r

Lament over Jerusalem

“Jerusalem,*rp Jerusalem,*r who*r kills*r the*r prophets*r and*r stones*r those*r who*r are*r sent*r to*r her!*r How*r often*r I*r wanted*r to*r gather*r your*r children*r together,*r the*r way*r a*r hen*r gathers*r her*r chicks*r under*r her*r wings,*r and*r you*r were*r unwilling.*r
